oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The use of feed blocks as supplementation for theupland hill flock: (1) Improving organic ewe productivity and performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McLean, Barbara M L
Frost, David
Evans, D Eifion
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheep and goats
Feeding and growth
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This report was presented at the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference of the Colloquium of Organic Researchers (COR). Maintaining ewe performance in winter poses particular problems for organic farming in the uplands where the availability of both grazing and home produced forage may be restricted. This trial evaluated approved non-organic feed blocks as dietary supplement for ewes grazing pastures between 300 and 550 m.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: McLean, Barbara M L; Frost, David and Evans, D Eifion (2002) The use of feed blocks as supplementation for theupland hill flock: (1) Improving organic ewe productivity and performance. In: Powell, Jane and et al., (Eds.) Proceedings of the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference, Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth, pp. 277-278.
